name: What Does That Saying Really Mean? Quiz | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Acceptance of what has happened is the first ________ to overcoming the consequences of misfortune!
questions.explanation:
step.

	Stated by noted American philosopher, William James.

questions.text: A _______ sea does not make a skilled sailor!
questions.explanation:
calm.

	This is an African proverb!

questions.text: Common _______ is genius dressed up in work clothes!
questions.explanation:
sense.

	Said by Ralph Waldo Emerson, 19th century poet, lecturer and essayist.

questions.text: Character is like a _______ and reputation like its shadow.
questions.explanation:
tree.

	Stated by Abraham Lincoln, former President of the USA.  The complete quote is, "Character is like a tree and reputation like its shadow.  The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing!"

questions.text: Change your ________ and you change your world!
questions.explanation:
thoughts.

	Said by author Norman Vincent Peale.

questions.text: What's the missing word: ________ is getting the answer 'yes' without asking a clear question!
questions.explanation:
charm.

	Spoken by Albert Camus, a French writer and essayist.

questions.text: Choose a ________ you like and you will never have to work a day of your life!
questions.explanation:
job.

	Spoken by the great sage himself, Confucius!

questions.text: Don't let anybody walk through your ________ with dirty feet!
questions.explanation:
mind.

	Said by the great non-violent and philosophical Mahatma Gandhi!

questions.text: What's the missing word: ___________ is only the opportunity to begin more intelligently!
questions.explanation:
failure.

	Stated by American innovator Henry Ford!

questions.text: Facts do not cease to exist because they are _________ !
questions.explanation:
ignored.

	Stated by world renowned author Aldous Huxley!
